tutorial_introduction.title: Welcome to the Dynamic GUI Builder Tutorial
tutorial_introduction.description: This tutorial explains how to create dynamic GUIs using the JSON-based configuration system. The system recursively builds a user interface from a JSON file, allowing for complex and nested layouts of control elements.

key_concepts.OcaBlock: The fundamental building block. It's a container for other GUI elements or other OcaBlocks, creating a hierarchical structure. It's rendered as a labeled frame.
key_concepts.fields: An object within an OcaBlock that holds the nested elements.
key_concepts.message_details: An object that contains the message information for a specific device model.
key_concepts.type: A string that specifies the type of GUI element to be created.

gui_element_types.title: GUI Element Types
gui_element_types.description: Here are the available GUI element types and their configurations.
gui_element_types.notes: The 'notes' field is available for every element. It is ignored by the builder but can be used for logging or leaving comments in the JSON file.

OcaBlock.description: A container for other elements. It creates a labeled frame.

my_block.description: This is a container for other elements.
my_block.notes: OcaBlocks are the main way to group elements.

GuiActuator.description: A button that triggers a message. The message is defined in the `message_details` of a parent `OcaBlock`.

my_actuator_block.notes: The message_details can be different for each device model.

Value.description: A non-editable field to display a value. This can be a static text or a value updated from a device.

sliderValue.description: A slider with a corresponding value display. It is used to set a numerical value within a range.

my_slider.notes: A composite control combining a slider and a value box.

GuiButtonToggle.description: A button that can be toggled on and off, representing a boolean state.

GuiButtonToggler.description: A button that cycles through a list of options.

my_toggler_button.notes: Use this for a smaller number of mutually exclusive choices.

GuiDropDownOption.description: A dropdown menu to select from a list of options.

my_dropdown.notes: Better for a longer list of choices.

GuiCheckbox.description: A standard checkbox to represent a boolean state.

my_checkbox.notes: A classic way to represent a boolean choice.

GuiListbox.description: A listbox to display a list of items. Items can be selected.

my_listbox.notes: Allows for single or multiple selections (not yet implemented).

LabelFromConfig.description: A label whose text is sourced from the config.ini file.

my_config_label.notes: The text will be the value of MyOption in the MySection section of config.ini.

ProgressBar.description: A progress bar to display the progress of a task. It can have units, min/max values, and a scale.

my_progress_bar.notes: Visually represents a value in a range.

TextInput.description: A single-line text input field for user-entered text.

WebLink.description: A clickable label that opens a URL in a web browser.

my_web_link.notes: Opens a link in the default web browser.

ImageDisplay.description: A widget to display a static image.

AnimationDisplay.description: A widget to display a specific frame of a GIF animation based on an input value.

my_animation.notes: The frame of the GIF is controlled by an input value.

VUMeter.description: A VU meter to display a value on a scale with a red zone.

Fader.description: A vertical or horizontal slider for controlling a value, styled like a fader on a mixing console.

Knob.description: A circular knob for controlling a value, like on an audio mixer.

my_knob.notes: A rotary control for a numerical value.

IncDecButtons.description: A set of buttons to increment or decrement a numerical value.

DirectionalButtons.description: A set of four buttons for directional control (Up, Down, Left, Right).

CustomFader.description: A custom-drawn fader for controlling a value.

my_custom_fader.notes: A fader with a custom look and feel.

my_custom_horizontal_fader.notes: A horizontal version of the CustomFader.

my_dial.notes: Similar to a knob, but with a different visual style.

NeedleVUMeter.description: A classic analog-style VU meter with a needle.

my_needle_vu.notes: An analog-style meter for a more vintage look.

my_panner.notes: Controls the left/right balance of an audio signal.

TrapezoidButton.description: A button with a trapezoidal shape.

my_trapezoid_button.notes: A button with a unique shape for visual distinction.

TrapezoidToggler.description: A toggling button with a trapezoidal shape.

my_trapezoid_toggler.notes: A toggle button with a trapezoidal shape.

HorizontalWithValue.description: A composite control with a horizontal dial and a value display.

my_horizontal_with_value.notes: A compact control for a single value.

DynamicGraph.description: A widget for plotting dynamic data.

BreakLine.description: A horizontal line to visually separate elements.

HeaderStatusLight.description: A status light for display in the header.

my_header_light.notes: Indicates a status in the main header of the application.

DynamicGuiTable.description: A table for displaying and editing data.

my_dynamic_table.notes: A powerful widget for tabular data.

layout_guide.title: Layout Guide
layout_guide.description: The GUI builder primarily uses a vertical layout. However, you can simulate a horizontal layout by nesting OcaBlocks. The current version of the builder does not support a dedicated horizontal layout property, but you can achieve a similar effect by creating a main OcaBlock for each horizontal section.

styling_guide.title: Styling Guide
styling_guide.description: The look and feel of the application can be customized by editing the `display/styling/style.py` file. This file contains themes with color definitions for different widgets and states. You can modify the existing 'dark' and 'light' themes, or create your own themes. To change the default theme, modify the `DEFAULT_THEME` variable in `display/styling/style.py`.

grouping_guide.title: How to Group Elements
grouping_guide.description: The `OcaBlock` is the primary way to group related GUI elements. By nesting `OcaBlock`s, you can create a clear and organized hierarchy in your user interface. Each `OcaBlock` is rendered as a labeled frame, providing a visual grouping for the elements it contains.

my_settings_panel.notes: A settings panel with user and application settings.

control_devices_guide.title: How to Build an Array of Control Devices
control_devices_guide.description: To control multiple devices, you can create an array of `OcaBlock`s, each with its own `message_details` for a specific device model. The GUI builder will select the appropriate `message_details` based on the connected device.

trace_control.notes: The correct command will be chosen based on the device model.

message_messages_guide.title: How to Build an Array of Messages
message_messages_guide.description: You can create complex commands with variable parts. Use `inputs` to define GUI elements that will provide values for the command string. Use `outputs` to display the data returned from the device.

set_level.notes: The '<level>' part of the command will be replaced with the value from the slider.

audio_console_example.title: 8-Channel Audio Console Example
audio_console_example.description: This example demonstrates how to create an 8-channel audio console using faders, knobs, and VU meters.

audio_console.notes: This is a complex example showing how to build a larger UI.
